1.verse: The Messiah’s Herald - The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

2.verse: As it is written in Isaiah the prophet: Look, I am sending My messenger ahead of You, who will prepare Your way.

3.verse: A voice of one crying out in the wilderness: Prepare the way for the Lord; make His paths straight!

4.verse: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

5.verse: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem were flocking to him, and they were baptized by him in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.

6.verse: John wore a camel-hair garment with a leather belt around his waist and ate locusts and wild honey.

7.verse: He was preaching: “Someone more powerful than I will come after me. I am not worthy to stoop down and untie the strap of His sandals.

8.verse: I have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”

9.verse: The Baptism of Jesus - In those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized in the Jordan by John.

10.verse: As soon as He came up out of the water, He saw the heavens being torn open and the Spirit descending to Him like a dove.

11.verse: And a voice came from heaven: You are My beloved Son; I take delight in You!

12.verse: The Temptation of Jesus - Immediately the Spirit drove Him into the wilderness.

13.verse: He was in the wilderness 40 days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and the angels began to serve Him.

14.verse: Ministry in Galilee - After John was arrested, Jesus went to Galilee, preaching the good news of God:

15.verse: “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe in the good news!”

16.verse: The First Disciples - As He was passing along by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew, Simon’s brother. They were casting a net into the sea, since they were fishermen.

17.verse: “Follow Me,” Jesus told them, “and I will make you fish for people!”

18.verse: Immediately they left their nets and followed Him.

19.verse: Going on a little farther, He saw James the son of Zebedee and his brother John. They were in their boat mending their nets.

20.verse: Immediately He called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed Him.

21.verse: Driving Out an Unclean Spirit - Then they went into Capernaum, and right away He entered the synagogue on the Sabbath and began to teach.

22.verse: They were astonished at His teaching because, unlike the scribes, He was teaching them as one having authority.

23.verse: Just then a man with an unclean spirit was in their synagogue. He cried out,

24.verse: “What do You have to do with us, Jesus—Nazarene? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”

25.verse: But Jesus rebuked him and said, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”

26.verse: And the unclean spirit convulsed him, shouted with a loud voice, and came out of him.

27.verse: Then they were all amazed, so they began to argue with one another, saying, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him.”

28.verse: News about Him then spread throughout the entire vicinity of Galilee.

29.verse: Healings at Capernaum - As soon as they left the synagogue, they went into Simon and Andrew’s house with James and John.

30.verse: Simon’s mother-in-law was lying in bed with a fever, and they told Him about her at once.

31.verse: So He went to her, took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she began to serve them.

32.verse: When evening came, after the sun had set, they began bringing to Him all those who were sick and those who were demon-possessed.

33.verse: The whole town was assembled at the door,

34.verse: and He healed many who were sick with various diseases and drove out many demons. But He would not permit the demons to speak, because they knew Him.

35.verse: Preaching in Galilee - Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, He got up, went out, and made His way to a deserted place. And He was praying there.

36.verse: Simon and his companions went searching for Him.

37.verse: They found Him and said, “Everyone’s looking for You!”

38.verse: And He said to them, “Let’s go on to the neighboring villages so that I may preach there too. This is why I have come.”

39.verse: So He went into all of Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.

40.verse: A Man Cleansed - Then a man with a serious skin disease came to Him and, on his knees, begged Him: “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”

41.verse: Moved with compassion, Jesus reached out His hand and touched him. “I am willing,” He told him. “Be made clean.”

42.verse: Immediately the disease left him, and he was healed.

43.verse: Then He sternly warned him and sent him away at once,

44.verse: telling him, “See that you say nothing to anyone; but go and show yourself to the priest, and offer what Moses prescribed for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”

45.verse: Yet he went out and began to proclaim it widely and to spread the news, with the result that Jesus could no longer enter a town openly. But He was out in deserted places, and they would come to Him from everywhere.

1.verse: The Son of Man Forgives and Heals - When He entered Capernaum again after some days, it was reported that He was at home.

2.verse: So many people gathered together that there was no more room, not even in the doorway, and He was speaking the message to them.

3.verse: Then they came to Him bringing a paralytic, carried by four men.

4.verse: Since they were not able to bring him to Jesus because of the crowd, they removed the roof above where He was. And when they had broken through, they lowered the mat on which the paralytic was lying.

5.verse: Seeing their faith, Jesus told the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”

6.verse: But some of the scribes were sitting there, thinking to themselves:

7.verse: “Why does He speak like this? He’s blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”

8.verse: Right away Jesus understood in His spirit that they were thinking like this within themselves and said to them, “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?

9.verse: Which is easier: to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, pick up your mat, and walk’?

10.verse: But so you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” He told the paralytic,

11.verse: “I tell you: get up, pick up your mat, and go home.”

12.verse: Immediately he got up, picked up the mat, and went out in front of everyone. As a result, they were all astounded and gave glory to God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”

13.verse: The Call of Matthew - Then Jesus went out again beside the sea. The whole crowd was coming to Him, and He taught them.

14.verse: Then, moving on, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office, and He said to him, “Follow Me!” So he got up and followed Him.

15.verse: Dining with Sinners - While He was reclining at the table in Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were also guests with Jesus and His disciples, because there were many who were following Him.

16.verse: When the scribes of the Pharisees saw that He was eating with sinners and tax collectors, they asked His disciples, “Why does He eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

17.verse: When Jesus heard this, He told them, “Those who are well don’t need a doctor, but the sick do need one. I didn’t come to call the righteous, but sinners.”

18.verse: A Question about Fasting - Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. People came and asked Him, “Why do John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”

19.verse: Jesus said to them, “The wedding guests cannot fast while the groom is with them, can they? As long as they have the groom with them, they cannot fast.

20.verse: But the time will come when the groom is taken away from them, and then they will fast in that day.

21.verse: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new patch pulls away from the old cloth, and a worse tear is made.

22.verse: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and the wine is lost as well as the skins. But new wine is for fresh wineskins.”

23.verse: Lord of the Sabbath - On the Sabbath He was going through the grainfields, and His disciples began to make their way picking some heads of grain.

24.verse: The Pharisees said to Him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”

25.verse: He said to them, “Have you never read what David and those who were with him did when he was in need and hungry—

26.verse: how he entered the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the sacred bread—which is not lawful for anyone to eat except the priests—and also gave some to his companions?”

27.verse: Then He told them, “The Sabbath was made for man and not man for the Sabbath.

28.verse: Therefore, the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”

1.verse: The Man with the Paralyzed Hand - Now He entered the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a paralyzed hand.

2.verse: In order to accuse Him, they were watching Him closely to see whether He would heal him on the Sabbath.

3.verse: He told the man with the paralyzed hand, “Stand before us.”

4.verse: Then He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do what is good or to do what is evil, to save life or to kill?” But they were silent.

5.verse: After looking around at them with anger and sorrow at the hardness of their hearts, He told the man, “Stretch out your hand.” So he stretched it out, and his hand was restored.

6.verse: Immediately the Pharisees went out and started plotting with the Herodians against Him, how they might destroy Him.

7.verse: Ministering to the Multitude - Jesus departed with His disciples to the sea, and a large crowd followed from Galilee, Judea,

8.verse: Jerusalem, Idumea, beyond the Jordan, and around Tyre and Sidon. The large crowd came to Him because they heard about everything He was doing.

9.verse: Then He told His disciples to have a small boat ready for Him, so the crowd would not crush Him.

10.verse: Since He had healed many, all who had diseases were pressing toward Him to touch Him.

11.verse: Whenever the unclean spirits saw Him, those possessed fell down before Him and cried out, “You are the Son of God!”

12.verse: And He would strongly warn them not to make Him known.

13.verse: The 12 Apostles - Then He went up the mountain and summoned those He wanted, and they came to Him.

14.verse: He also appointed 12—He also named them apostles—to be with Him, to send them out to preach,

15.verse: and to have authority to drive out demons.

16.verse: He appointed the Twelve: To Simon, He gave the name Peter;

17.verse: and to James the son of Zebedee, and to his brother John, He gave the name “Boanerges” (that is, “Sons of Thunder”);

18.verse: Andrew; Philip and Bartholomew; Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot,

19.verse: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.

20.verse: A House Divided - Then He went home, and the crowd gathered again so that they were not even able to eat.

21.verse: When His family heard this, they set out to restrain Him, because they said, “He’s out of His mind.”

22.verse: The scribes who had come down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul in Him!” and, “He drives out demons by the ruler of the demons!”

23.verse: So He summoned them and spoke to them in parables: “How can Satan drive out Satan?

24.verse: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

25.verse: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

26.verse: And if Satan rebels against himself and is divided, he cannot stand but is finished!

27.verse: “On the other hand, no one can enter a strong man’s house and rob his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man. Then he will rob his house.

28.verse: I assure you: People will be forgiven for all sins and whatever blasphemies they may blaspheme.

29.verse: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin”—

30.verse: because they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”

31.verse: True Relationships - Then His mother and His brothers came, and standing outside, they sent word to Him and called Him.

32.verse: A crowd was sitting around Him and told Him, “Look, Your mother, Your brothers, and Your sisters are outside asking for You.”

33.verse: He replied to them, “Who are My mother and My brothers?”

34.verse: And looking about at those who were sitting in a circle around Him, He said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!

35.verse: Whoever does the will of God is My brother and sister and mother.”

1.verse: The Parable of the Sower - Again He began to teach by the sea, and a very large crowd gathered around Him. So He got into a boat on the sea and sat down, while the whole crowd was on the shore facing the sea.

2.verse: He taught them many things in parables, and in His teaching He said to them:

3.verse: “Listen! Consider the sower who went out to sow.

4.verse: As he sowed, this occurred: Some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

5.verse: Other seed fell on rocky ground where it didn’t have much soil, and it sprang up right away, since it didn’t have deep soil.

6.verse: When the sun came up, it was scorched, and since it didn’t have a root, it withered.

7.verse: Other seed fell among thorns, and the thorns came up and choked it, and it didn’t produce a crop.

8.verse: Still others fell on good ground and produced a crop that increased 30, 60, and 100 times what was sown.”

9.verse: Then He said, “Anyone who has ears to hear should listen!”

10.verse: Why Jesus Used Parables - When He was alone with the Twelve, those who were around Him asked Him about the parables.

11.verse: He answered them, “The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you, but to those outside, everything comes in parables

12.verse: so that they may look and look, yet not perceive; they may listen and listen, yet not understand; otherwise, they might turn back— and be forgiven.”

13.verse: The Parable of the Sower Explained - Then He said to them: “Don’t you understand this parable? How then will you understand any of the parables?

15.verse: These are the ones along the path where the word is sown: when they hear, immediately Satan comes and takes away the word sown in them.

16.verse: And these are the ones sown on rocky ground: when they hear the word, immediately they receive it with joy.

17.verse: But they have no root in themselves; they are short-lived. When pressure or persecution comes because of the word, they immediately stumble.

18.verse: Others are sown among thorns; these are the ones who hear the word,

19.verse: but the worries of this age, the seduction of wealth, and the desires for other things enter in and choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

20.verse: But the ones sown on good ground are those who hear the word, welcome it, and produce a crop: 30, 60, and 100 times what was sown.”

21.verse: Using Your Light - He also said to them, “Is a lamp brought in to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn’t it to be put on a lampstand?

22.verse: For nothing is concealed except to be revealed, and nothing hidden except to come to light.

23.verse: If anyone has ears to hear, he should listen!”

24.verse: Then He said to them, “Pay attention to what you hear. By the measure you use, it will be measured and added to you.

25.verse: For to the one who has, it will be given, and from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.”

26.verse: The Parable of the Growing Seed - “The kingdom of God is like this,” He said. “A man scatters seed on the ground;

27.verse: he sleeps and rises—night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows—he doesn’t know how.

28.verse: The soil produces a crop by itself—first the blade, then the head, and then the ripe grain on the head.

29.verse: But as soon as the crop is ready, he sends for the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

30.verse: The Parable of the Mustard Seed - And He said: “How can we illustrate the kingdom of God, or what parable can we use to describe it?

31.verse: It’s like a mustard seed that, when sown in the soil, is smaller than all the seeds on the ground.

32.verse: And when sown, it comes up and grows taller than all the vegetables, and produces large branches, so that the birds of the sky can nest in its shade.”

33.verse: Using Parables - He would speak the word to them with many parables like these, as they were able to understand.

34.verse: And He did not speak to them without a parable. Privately, however, He would explain everything to His own disciples.

35.verse: Wind and Wave Obey the Master - On that day, when evening had come, He told them, “Let’s cross over to the other side of the sea.”

36.verse: So they left the crowd and took Him along since He was already in the boat. And other boats were with Him.

37.verse: A fierce windstorm arose, and the waves were breaking over the boat, so that the boat was already being swamped.

38.verse: But He was in the stern, sleeping on the cushion. So they woke Him up and said to Him, “Teacher! Don’t You care that we’re going to die?”

39.verse: He got up, rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Silence! Be still!” The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

40.verse: Then He said to them, “Why are you fearful? Do you still have no faith?”

41.verse: And they were terrified and asked one another, “Who then is this? Even the wind and the sea obey Him!”

1.verse: Demons Driven Out by the Master - Then they came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the Gerasenes.

2.verse: As soon as He got out of the boat, a man with an unclean spirit came out of the tombs and met Him.

3.verse: He lived in the tombs. No one was able to restrain him anymore—even with chains—

4.verse: because he often had been bound with shackles and chains, but had snapped off the chains and smashed the shackles. No one was strong enough to subdue him.

5.verse: And always, night and day, he was crying out among the tombs and in the mountains and cutting himself with stones.

6.verse: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and knelt down before Him.

7.verse: And he cried out with a loud voice, “What do You have to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg You before God, don’t torment me!”

8.verse: For He had told him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”

9.verse: “What is your name?” He asked him. “My name is Legion,” he answered Him, “because we are many.”

10.verse: And he kept begging Him not to send them out of the region.

11.verse: Now a large herd of pigs was there, feeding on the hillside.

12.verse: The demons begged Him, “Send us to the pigs, so we may enter them.”

13.verse: And He gave them permission. Then the unclean spirits came out and entered the pigs, and the herd of about 2,000 rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned there.

14.verse: The men who tended them ran off and reported it in the town and the countryside, and people went to see what had happened.

15.verse: They came to Jesus and saw the man who had been demon-possessed by the legion, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

16.verse: The eyewitnesses described to them what had happened to the demon-possessed man and told about the pigs.

17.verse: Then they began to beg Him to leave their region.

18.verse: As He was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed kept begging Him to be with Him.

19.verse: But He would not let him; instead, He told him, “Go back home to your own people, and report to them how much the Lord has done for you and how He has had mercy on you.”

20.verse: So he went out and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him, and they were all amazed.

21.verse: A Girl Restored and a Woman Healed - When Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around Him while He was by the sea.

22.verse: One of the synagogue leaders, named Jairus, came, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at His feet

23.verse: and kept begging Him, “My little daughter is at death’s door. Come and lay Your hands on her so she can get well and live.”

24.verse: So Jesus went with him, and a large crowd was following and pressing against Him.

25.verse: A woman suffering from bleeding for 12 years

26.verse: had endured much under many doctors. She had spent everything she had and was not helped at all. On the contrary, she became worse.

27.verse: Having heard about Jesus, she came behind Him in the crowd and touched His robe.

28.verse: For she said, “If I can just touch His robes, I’ll be made well!”

29.verse: Instantly her flow of blood ceased, and she sensed in her body that she was cured of her affliction.

30.verse: At once Jesus realized in Himself that power had gone out from Him. He turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My robes?”

31.verse: His disciples said to Him, “You see the crowd pressing against You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’”

32.verse: So He was looking around to see who had done this.

33.verse: Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came with fear and trembling, fell down before Him, and told Him the whole truth.

34.verse: “Daughter,” He said to her, “your faith has made you well. Go in peace and be free from your affliction.”

35.verse: While He was still speaking, people came from the synagogue leader’s house and said, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher anymore?”

36.verse: But when Jesus overheard what was said, He told the synagogue leader, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe.”

37.verse: He did not let anyone accompany Him except Peter, James, and John, James’s brother.

38.verse: They came to the leader’s house, and He saw a commotion—people weeping and wailing loudly.

39.verse: He went in and said to them, “Why are you making a commotion and weeping? The child is not dead but asleep.”

40.verse: They started laughing at Him, but He put them all outside. He took the child’s father, mother, and those who were with Him, and entered the place where the child was.

41.verse: Then He took the child by the hand and said to her, “Talitha koum!” (which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”).

42.verse: Immediately the girl got up and began to walk. (She was 12 years old.) At this they were utterly astounded.

43.verse: Then He gave them strict orders that no one should know about this and said that she should be given something to eat.

1.verse: Rejection at Nazareth - He went away from there and came to His hometown, and His disciples followed Him.

2.verse: When the Sabbath came, He began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard Him were astonished. “Where did this man get these things?” they said. “What is this wisdom given to Him, and how are these miracles performed by His hands?

3.verse: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and the brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And aren’t His sisters here with us?” So they were offended by Him.

4.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown, among his relatives, and in his household.”

5.verse: So He was not able to do any miracles there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.

6.verse: And He was amazed at their unbelief. Commissioning the Twelve - Now He was going around the villages in a circuit, teaching.

7.verse: He summoned the Twelve and began to send them out in pairs and gave them authority over unclean spirits.

8.verse: He instructed them to take nothing for the road except a walking stick: no bread, no traveling bag, no money in their belts.

9.verse: They were to wear sandals, but not put on an extra shirt.

10.verse: Then He said to them, “Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that place.

11.verse: If any place does not welcome you and people refuse to listen to you, when you leave there, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”

12.verse: So they went out and preached that people should repent.

13.verse: And they were driving out many demons, anointing many sick people with olive oil, and healing them.

14.verse: John the Baptist Beheaded - King Herod heard of this, because Jesus’ name had become well known. Some said, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that’s why supernatural powers are at work in him.”

15.verse: But others said, “He’s Elijah.” Still others said, “He’s a prophet—like one of the prophets.”

16.verse: When Herod heard of it, he said, “John, the one I beheaded, has been raised!”

17.verse: For Herod himself had given orders to arrest John and to chain him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, whom he had married.

18.verse: John had been telling Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife!”

19.verse: So Herodias held a grudge against him and wanted to kill him. But she could not,

20.verse: because Herod was in awe of John and was protecting him, knowing he was a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard him he would be very disturbed, yet would hear him gladly.

21.verse: Now an opportune time came on his birthday, when Herod gave a banquet for his nobles, military commanders, and the leading men of Galilee.

22.verse: When Herodias’s own daughter came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you want, and I’ll give it to you.”

23.verse: So he swore oaths to her: “Whatever you ask me I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”

24.verse: Then she went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” “John the Baptist’s head!” she said.

25.verse: Immediately she hurried to the king and said, “I want you to give me John the Baptist’s head on a platter—right now!”

26.verse: Though the king was deeply distressed, because of his oaths and the guests he did not want to refuse her.

27.verse: The king immediately sent for an executioner and commanded him to bring John’s head. So he went and beheaded him in prison,

28.verse: brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl. Then the girl gave it to her mother.

29.verse: When his disciples heard about it, they came and removed his corpse and placed it in a tomb.

30.verse: Feeding 5,000 - The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to Him all that they had done and taught.

31.verse: He said to them, “Come away by yourselves to a remote place and rest for a while.” For many people were coming and going, and they did not even have time to eat.

32.verse: So they went away in the boat by themselves to a remote place,

33.verse: but many saw them leaving and recognized them. People ran there by land from all the towns and arrived ahead of them.

34.verse: So as He stepped ashore, He saw a huge crowd and had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. Then He began to teach them many things.

35.verse: When it was already late, His disciples approached Him and said, “This place is a wilderness, and it is already late!

36.verse: Send them away, so they can go into the surrounding countryside and villages to buy themselves something to eat.”

37.verse: “You give them something to eat,” He responded. They said to Him, “Should we go and buy 200 denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?”

38.verse: And He asked them, “How many loaves do you have? Go look.” When they found out they said, “Five, and two fish.”

39.verse: Then He instructed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.

40.verse: So they sat down in ranks of hundreds and fifties.

41.verse: Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke the loaves. He kept giving them to His disciples to set before the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.

43.verse: Then they picked up 12 baskets full of pieces of bread and fish.

44.verse: Now those who ate the loaves were 5,000 men.

45.verse: Walking on the Water - Immediately He made His disciples get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He dismissed the crowd.

46.verse: After He said good-bye to them, He went away to the mountain to pray.

47.verse: When evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and He was alone on the land.

48.verse: He saw them being battered as they rowed, because the wind was against them. Around three in the morning He came toward them walking on the sea and wanted to pass by them.

49.verse: When they saw Him walking on the sea, they thought it was a ghost and cried out;

50.verse: for they all saw Him and were terrified. Immediately He spoke with them and said, “Have courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.”

51.verse: Then He got into the boat with them, and the wind ceased. They were completely astounded,

52.verse: because they had not understood about the loaves. Instead, their hearts were hardened.

53.verse: Miraculous Healings - When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret and beached the boat.

54.verse: As they got out of the boat, people immediately recognized Him.

55.verse: They hurried throughout that vicinity and began to carry the sick on mats to wherever they heard He was.

56.verse: Wherever He would go, into villages, towns, or the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces and begged Him that they might touch just the tassel of His robe. And everyone who touched it was made well.

1.verse: The Traditions of the Elders - The Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Him.

2.verse: They observed that some of His disciples were eating their bread with unclean—that is, unwashed—hands.

3.verse: (For the Pharisees, in fact all the Jews, will not eat unless they wash their hands ritually, keeping the tradition of the elders.

4.verse: When they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they have washed. And there are many other customs they have received and keep, like the washing of cups, jugs, copper utensils, and dining couches.)

5.verse: Then the Pharisees and the scribes asked Him, “Why don’t Your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders, instead of eating bread with ritually unclean hands?”

6.verse: He answered them, “Isaiah prophesied correctly about you hypocrites, as it is written: These people honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me.

7.verse: They worship Me in vain, teaching as doctrines the commands of men.

8.verse: Disregarding the command of God, you keep the tradition of men.”

9.verse: He also said to them, “You completely invalidate God’s command in order to maintain your tradition!

10.verse: For Moses said: Honor your father and your mother; and Whoever speaks evil of father or mother must be put to death.

11.verse: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or mother: Whatever benefit you might have received from me is Corban’” (that is, a gift committed to the temple),

12.verse: “you no longer let him do anything for his father or mother.

13.verse: You revoke God’s word by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many other similar things.”

14.verse: Summoning the crowd again, He told them, “Listen to Me, all of you, and understand:

15.verse: Nothing that goes into a person from outside can defile him, but the things that come out of a person are what defile him.

16.verse: [ If anyone has ears to hear, he should listen!]”

17.verse: When He went into the house away from the crowd, the disciples asked Him about the parable.

18.verse: And He said to them, “Are you also as lacking in understanding? Don’t you realize that nothing going into a man from the outside can defile him?

19.verse: For it doesn’t go into his heart but into the stomach and is eliminated.” (As a result, He made all foods clean.)

20.verse: Then He said, “What comes out of a person—that defiles him.

21.verse: For from within, out of people’s hearts, come evil thoughts, sexual immoralities, thefts, murders,

22.verse: adulteries, greed, evil actions, deceit, promiscuity, stinginess, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.

23.verse: All these evil things come from within and defile a person.”

24.verse: A Gentile Mother’s Faith - He got up and departed from there to the region of Tyre and Sidon. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it, but He could not escape notice.

25.verse: Instead, immediately after hearing about Him, a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit came and fell at His feet.

26.verse: Now the woman was Greek, a Syrophoenician by birth, and she kept asking Him to drive the demon out of her daughter.

27.verse: He said to her, “Allow the children to be satisfied first, because it isn’t right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

28.verse: But she replied to Him, “Lord, even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”

29.verse: Then He told her, “Because of this reply, you may go. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”

30.verse: When she went back to her home, she found her child lying on the bed, and the demon was gone.

31.verse: Jesus Does Everything Well - Again, leaving the region of Tyre, He went by way of Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, through the region of the Decapolis.

32.verse: They brought to Him a deaf man who also had a speech difficulty, and begged Jesus to lay His hand on him.

33.verse: So He took him away from the crowd privately. After putting His fingers in the man’s ears and spitting, He touched his tongue.

34.verse: Then, looking up to heaven, He sighed deeply and said to him, “Ephphatha!” (that is, “Be opened!”).

35.verse: Immediately his ears were opened, his speech difficulty was removed, and he began to speak clearly.

36.verse: Then He ordered them to tell no one, but the more He would order them, the more they would proclaim it.

37.verse: They were extremely astonished and said, “He has done everything well! He even makes deaf people hear, and people unable to speak, talk!”

1.verse: Feeding 4,000 - In those days there was again a large crowd, and they had nothing to eat. He summoned the disciples and said to them,

2.verse: “I have compassion on the crowd, because they’ve already stayed with Me three days and have nothing to eat.

3.verse: If I send them home hungry, they will collapse on the way, and some of them have come a long distance.”

4.verse: His disciples answered Him, “Where can anyone get enough bread here in this desolate place to fill these people?”

5.verse: “How many loaves do you have?” He asked them. “Seven,” they said.

6.verse: Then He commanded the crowd to sit down on the ground. Taking the seven loaves, He gave thanks, broke the loaves, and kept on giving them to His disciples to set before the people. So they served the loaves to the crowd.

7.verse: They also had a few small fish, and when He had blessed them, He said these were to be served as well.

8.verse: They ate and were filled. Then they collected seven large baskets of leftover pieces.

9.verse: About 4,000 men were there. He dismissed them

10.verse: and immediately got into the boat with His disciples and went to the district of Dalmanutha.

11.verse: The Yeast of the Pharisees and Herod - The Pharisees came out and began to argue with Him, demanding of Him a sign from heaven to test Him.

12.verse: But sighing deeply in His spirit, He said, “Why does this generation demand a sign? I assure you: No sign will be given to this generation!”

13.verse: Then He left them, got on board the boat again, and went to the other side.

14.verse: They had forgotten to take bread and had only one loaf with them in the boat.

15.verse: Then He commanded them: “Watch out! Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

16.verse: They were discussing among themselves that they did not have any bread.

17.verse: Aware of this, He said to them, “Why are you discussing that you do not have any bread? Don’t you understand or comprehend? Is your heart hardened?

18.verse: Do you have eyes, and not see, and do you have ears, and not hear? And do you not remember?

19.verse: When I broke the five loaves for the 5,000, how many baskets full of pieces of bread did you collect?” “Twelve,” they told Him.

20.verse: “When I broke the seven loaves for the 4,000, how many large baskets full of pieces of bread did you collect?” “Seven,” they said.

21.verse: And He said to them, “Don’t you understand yet?”

22.verse: Healing a Blind Man - Then they came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to Him and begged Him to touch him.

23.verse: He took the blind man by the hand and brought him out of the village. Spitting on his eyes and laying His hands on him, He asked him, “Do you see anything?”

24.verse: He looked up and said, “I see people—they look to me like trees walking.”

25.verse: Again Jesus placed His hands on the man’s eyes, and he saw distinctly. He was cured and could see everything clearly.

26.verse: Then He sent him home, saying, “Don’t even go into the village.”

27.verse: Peter’s Confession of the Messiah - Jesus went out with His disciples to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. And on the road He asked His disciples, “Who do people say that I am?”

28.verse: They answered Him, “John the Baptist; others, Elijah; still others, one of the prophets.”

29.verse: “But you,” He asked them again, “who do you say that I am?” Peter answered Him, “You are the Messiah!”

30.verse: And He strictly warned them to tell no one about Him.

31.verse: His Death and Resurrection Predicted - Then He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, be killed, and rise after three days.

32.verse: He was openly talking about this. So Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.

33.verse: But turning around and looking at His disciples, He rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind Me, Satan, because you’re not thinking about God’s concerns, but man’s!”

34.verse: Take Up Your Cross - Summoning the crowd along with His disciples, He said to them, “If anyone wants to be My follower, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow Me.

35.verse: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life because of Me and the gospel will save it.

36.verse: For what does it benefit a man to gain the whole world yet lose his life?

37.verse: What can a man give in exchange for his life?

38.verse: For whoever is ashamed of Me and of My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.”

1.verse: Then He said to them, “I assure you: There are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God come in power.”

2.verse: The Transfiguration - After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John and led them up on a high mountain by themselves to be alone. He was transformed in front of them,

3.verse: and His clothes became dazzling—extremely white as no launderer on earth could whiten them.

4.verse: Elijah appeared to them with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.

5.verse: Then Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it’s good for us to be here! Let us make three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah”—

6.verse: because he did not know what he should say, since they were terrified.

7.verse: A cloud appeared, overshadowing them, and a voice came from the cloud: This is My beloved Son; listen to Him!

8.verse: Then suddenly, looking around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus alone.

9.verse: As they were coming down from the mountain, He ordered them to tell no one what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

10.verse: They kept this word to themselves, discussing what “rising from the dead” meant.

11.verse: Then they began to question Him, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

12.verse: “Elijah does come first and restores everything,” He replied. “How then is it written about the Son of Man that He must suffer many things and be treated with contempt?

13.verse: But I tell you that Elijah really has come, and they did whatever they pleased to him, just as it is written about him.”

14.verse: The Power of Faith over a Demon - When they came to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and scribes disputing with them.

15.verse: All of a sudden, when the whole crowd saw Him, they were amazed and ran to greet Him.

16.verse: Then He asked them, “What are you arguing with them about?”

17.verse: Out of the crowd, one man answered Him, “Teacher, I brought my son to You. He has a spirit that makes him unable to speak.

18.verse: Wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. So I asked Your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn’t.”

19.verse: He replied to them, “You unbelieving generation! How long will I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him to Me.”

20.verse: So they brought him to Him. When the spirit saw Him, it immediately convulsed the boy. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.

21.verse: “How long has this been happening to him?” Jesus asked his father. “From childhood,” he said.

22.verse: “And many times it has thrown him into fire or water to destroy him. But if You can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”

23.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “‘If You can’? Everything is possible to the one who believes.”

24.verse: Immediately the father of the boy cried out, “I do believe! Help my unbelief.”

25.verse: When Jesus saw that a crowd was rapidly coming together, He rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you: come out of him and never enter him again!”

26.verse: Then it came out, shrieking and convulsing him violently. The boy became like a corpse, so that many said, “He’s dead.”

27.verse: But Jesus, taking him by the hand, raised him, and he stood up.

28.verse: After He went into a house, His disciples asked Him privately, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”

29.verse: And He told them, “This kind can come out by nothing but prayer [and fasting].”

30.verse: The Second Prediction of His Death - Then they left that place and made their way through Galilee, but He did not want anyone to know it.

31.verse: For He was teaching His disciples and telling them, “The Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of men. They will kill Him, and after He is killed, He will rise three days later.”

32.verse: But they did not understand this statement, and they were afraid to ask Him.

33.verse: Who is the Greatest? - Then they came to Capernaum. When He was in the house, He asked them, “What were you arguing about on the way?”

34.verse: But they were silent, because on the way they had been arguing with one another about who was the greatest.

35.verse: Sitting down, He called the Twelve and said to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”

36.verse: Then He took a child, had him stand among them, and taking him in His arms, He said to them,

37.verse: “Whoever welcomes one little child such as this in My name welcomes Me. And whoever welcomes Me does not welcome Me, but Him who sent Me.”

38.verse: In His Name - John said to Him, “Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons in Your name, and we tried to stop him because he wasn’t following us.”

39.verse: “Don’t stop him,” said Jesus, “because there is no one who will perform a miracle in My name who can soon afterward speak evil of Me.

40.verse: For whoever is not against us is for us.

41.verse: And whoever gives you a cup of water to drink because of My name, since you belong to the Messiah—I assure you: He will never lose his reward.

42.verse: Warnings from Jesus - “But whoever causes the downfall of one of these little ones who believe in Me—it would be better for him if a heavy millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea.

43.verse: And if your hand causes your downfall, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than to have two hands and go to hell—the unquenchable fire,

44.verse: [ where Their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.]

45.verse: And if your foot causes your downfall, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life lame than to have two feet and be thrown into hell— [the unquenchable fire,

46.verse: where Their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.]

47.verse: And if your eye causes your downfall, gouge it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,

48.verse: where Their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.

49.verse: For everyone will be salted with fire.

50.verse: Salt is good, but if the salt should lose its flavor, how can you make it salty? Have salt among yourselves and be at peace with one another.”

1.verse: The Question of Divorce - He set out from there and went to the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Then crowds converged on Him again and, as He usually did, He began teaching them once more.

2.verse: Some Pharisees approached Him to test Him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”

3.verse: He replied to them, “What did Moses command you?”

4.verse: They said, “Moses permitted us to write divorce papers and send her away.”

5.verse: But Jesus told them, “He wrote this command for you because of the hardness of your hearts.

6.verse: But from the beginning of creation God made them male and female.

7.verse: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother [and be joined to his wife],

8.verse: and the two will become one flesh. So they are no longer two, but one flesh.

9.verse: Therefore what God has joined together, man must not separate.”

10.verse: Now in the house the disciples questioned Him again about this matter.

11.verse: And He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.

12.verse: Also, if she divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”

13.verse: Blessing the Children - Some people were bringing little children to Him so He might touch them, but His disciples rebuked them.

14.verse: When Jesus saw it, He was indignant and said to them, “Let the little children come to Me. Don’t stop them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

15.verse: I assure you: Whoever does not welcome the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”

16.verse: After taking them in His arms, He laid His hands on them and blessed them.

17.verse: The Rich Young Ruler - As He was setting out on a journey, a man ran up, knelt down before Him, and asked Him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

18.verse: “Why do you call Me good?” Jesus asked him. “No one is good but One—God.

19.verse: You know the commandments: Do not murder; do not commit adultery; do not steal; do not bear false witness; do not defraud; honor your father and mother.”

20.verse: He said to Him, “Teacher, I have kept all these from my youth.”

21.verse: Then, looking at him, Jesus loved him and said to him, “You lack one thing: Go, sell all you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow Me.”

22.verse: But he was stunned at this demand, and he went away grieving, because he had many possessions.

23.verse: Possessions and the Kingdom - Jesus looked around and said to His disciples, “How hard it is for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God!”

24.verse: But the disciples were astonished at His words. Again Jesus said to them, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: So they were even more astonished, saying to one another, “Then who can be saved?”

27.verse: Looking at them, Jesus said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God, because all things are possible with God.”

28.verse: Peter began to tell Him, “Look, we have left everything and followed You.”

29.verse: “I assure you,” Jesus said, “there is no one who has left house, brothers or sisters, mother or father, children, or fields because of Me and the gospel,

30.verse: who will not receive 100 times more, now at this time—houses, brothers and sisters, mothers and children, and fields, with persecutions—and eternal life in the age to come.

31.verse: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”

32.verse: The Third Prediction of His Death - They were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was walking ahead of them. They were astonished, but those who followed Him were afraid. Taking the Twelve aside again, He began to tell them the things that would happen to Him.

33.verse: “Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn Him to death. Then they will hand Him over to the Gentiles,

34.verse: and they will mock Him, spit on Him, flog Him, and kill Him, and He will rise after three days.”

35.verse: Suffering and Service - Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, approached Him and said, “Teacher, we want You to do something for us if we ask You.”

36.verse: “What do you want Me to do for you?” He asked them.

37.verse: They answered Him, “Allow us to sit at Your right and at Your left in Your glory.”

38.verse: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you’re asking. Are you able to drink the cup I drink or to be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with?”

39.verse: “We are able,” they told Him. Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink, and you will be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with.

40.verse: But to sit at My right or left is not Mine to give; instead, it is for those it has been prepared for.”

41.verse: When the other 10 disciples heard this, they began to be indignant with James and John.

42.verse: Jesus called them over and said to them, “You know that those who are regarded as rulers of the Gentiles dominate them, and their men of high positions exercise power over them.

43.verse: But it must not be like that among you. On the contrary, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

44.verse: and whoever wants to be first among you must be a slave to all.

45.verse: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life—a ransom for many.”

46.verse: A Blind Man Healed - They came to Jericho. And as He was leaving Jericho with His disciples and a large crowd, Bartimaeus (the son of Timaeus), a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

47.verse: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, “Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me!”

48.verse: Many people told him to keep quiet, but he was crying out all the more, “Have mercy on me, Son of David!”

49.verse: Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.” So they called the blind man and said to him, “Have courage! Get up; He’s calling for you.”

50.verse: He threw off his coat, jumped up, and came to Jesus.

51.verse: Then Jesus answered him, “What do you want Me to do for you?” “Rabbouni,” the blind man told Him, “I want to see!”

52.verse: “Go your way,” Jesus told him. “Your faith has healed you.” Immediately he could see and began to follow Him on the road.

1.verse: The Triumphal Entry - When they approached Jerusalem, at Bethphage and Bethany near the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples

2.verse: and told them, “Go into the village ahead of you. As soon as you enter it, you will find a young donkey tied there, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it here.

3.verse: If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here right away.’”

4.verse: So they went and found a young donkey outside in the street, tied by a door. They untied it,

5.verse: and some of those standing there said to them, “What are you doing, untying the donkey?”

6.verse: They answered them just as Jesus had said, so they let them go.

7.verse: Then they brought the donkey to Jesus and threw their robes on it, and He sat on it.

8.verse: Many people spread their robes on the road, and others spread leafy branches cut from the fields.

9.verse: Then those who went ahead and those who followed kept shouting: Hosanna! He who comes in the name of the Lord is the blessed One!

10.verse: The coming kingdom of our father David is blessed! Hosanna in the highest heaven!

11.verse: And He went into Jerusalem and into the temple complex. After looking around at everything, since it was already late, He went out to Bethany with the Twelve.

12.verse: The Barren Fig Tree Is Cursed - The next day when they came out from Bethany, He was hungry.

13.verse: After seeing in the distance a fig tree with leaves, He went to find out if there was anything on it. When He came to it, He found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.

14.verse: He said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” And His disciples heard it.

15.verse: Cleansing the Temple Complex - They came to Jerusalem, and He went into the temple complex and began to throw out those buying and selling in the temple. He overturned the money changers’ tables and the chairs of those selling doves,

16.verse: and would not permit anyone to carry goods through the temple complex.

17.verse: Then He began to teach them: “Is it not written, My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations? But you have made it a den of thieves!”

18.verse: Then the chief priests and the scribes heard it and started looking for a way to destroy Him. For they were afraid of Him, because the whole crowd was astonished by His teaching.

19.verse: And whenever evening came, they would go out of the city.

20.verse: The Barren Fig Tree Is Withered - Early in the morning, as they were passing by, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots up.

21.verse: Then Peter remembered and said to Him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that You cursed is withered.”

22.verse: Jesus replied to them, “Have faith in God.

23.verse: I assure you: If anyone says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.

24.verse: Therefore I tell you, all the things you pray and ask for—believe that you have received them, and you will have them.

25.verse: And whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him, so that your Father in heaven will also forgive you your wrongdoing.

26.verse: [ But if you don’t forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your wrongdoing.]”

27.verse: Messiah’s Authority Challenged - They came again to Jerusalem. As He was walking in the temple complex, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came

28.verse: and asked Him, “By what authority are You doing these things? Who gave You this authority to do these things?”

29.verse: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question; then answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

30.verse: Was John’s baptism from heaven or from men? Answer Me.”

31.verse: They began to argue among themselves: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’

32.verse: But if we say, ‘From men’”—they were afraid of the crowd, because everyone thought that John was a genuine prophet.

33.verse: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

1.verse: The Parable of the Vineyard Owner - Then He began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard, put a fence around it, dug out a pit for a winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went away.

2.verse: At harvest time he sent a slave to the farmers to collect some of the fruit of the vineyard from the farmers.

3.verse: But they took him, beat him, and sent him away empty-handed.

4.verse: Again he sent another slave to them, and they hit him on the head and treated him shamefully.

5.verse: Then he sent another, and they killed that one. He also sent many others; they beat some and they killed some.

6.verse: “He still had one to send, a beloved son. Finally he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

7.verse: “But those tenant farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours!’

8.verse: So they seized him, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.

9.verse: “Therefore, what will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers and give the vineyard to others.

10.verse: Haven’t you read this Scripture: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.

11.verse: This came from the Lord and is wonderful in our eyes?”

12.verse: Because they knew He had said this parable against them, they were looking for a way to arrest Him, but they were afraid of the crowd. So they left Him and went away.

13.verse: God and Caesar - Then they sent some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to Him to trap Him by what He said.

14.verse: When they came, they said to Him, “Teacher, we know You are truthful and defer to no one, for You don’t show partiality but teach truthfully the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not?

15.verse: Should we pay, or should we not pay?” But knowing their hypocrisy, He said to them, “Why are you testing Me? Bring Me a denarius to look at.”

16.verse: So they brought one. “Whose image and inscription is this?” He asked them. “Caesar’s,” they said.

17.verse: Then Jesus told them, “Give back to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were amazed at Him.

18.verse: The Sadducees and the Resurrection - Some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him and questioned Him:

19.verse: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies, leaves his wife behind, and leaves no child, his brother should take the wife and produce offspring for his brother.

20.verse: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying, left no offspring.

21.verse: The second also took her, and he died, leaving no offspring. And the third likewise.

22.verse: So the seven left no offspring. Last of all, the woman died too.

23.verse: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be, since the seven had married her?”

24.verse: Jesus told them, “Are you not deceived because you don’t know the Scriptures or the power of God?

25.verse: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like angels in heaven.

26.verse: Now concerning the dead being raised—haven’t you read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the burning bush, how God spoke to him: I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob?

27.verse: He is not God of the dead but of the living. You are badly deceived.”

28.verse: The Primary Commands - One of the scribes approached. When he heard them debating and saw that Jesus answered them well, he asked Him, “Which command is the most important of all?”

29.verse: “This is the most important,” Jesus answered: Listen, Israel! The Lord our God, the Lord is One.

30.verse: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.

31.verse: “The second is: Love your neighbor as yourself. There is no other command greater than these.”

32.verse: Then the scribe said to Him, “You are right, Teacher! You have correctly said that He is One, and there is no one else except Him.

33.verse: And to love Him with all your heart, with all your understanding, and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself, is far more important than all the burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

34.verse: When Jesus saw that he answered intelligently, He said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And no one dared to question Him any longer.

35.verse: The Question about the Messiah - So Jesus asked this question as He taught in the temple complex, “How can the scribes say that the Messiah is the Son of David?

36.verse: David himself says by the Holy Spirit: The Lord declared to my Lord, ‘Sit at My right hand until I put Your enemies under Your feet.’

37.verse: David himself calls Him ‘Lord’; how then can the Messiah be his Son?” And the large crowd was listening to Him with delight.

38.verse: Warning against the Scribes - He also said in His teaching, “Beware of the scribes, who want to go around in long robes, and who want greetings in the marketplaces,

39.verse: the front seats in the synagogues, and the places of honor at banquets.

40.verse: They devour widows’ houses and say long prayers just for show. These will receive harsher punishment.”

41.verse: The Widow’s Gift - Sitting across from the temple treasury, He watched how the crowd dropped money into the treasury. Many rich people were putting in large sums.

42.verse: And a poor widow came and dropped in two tiny coins worth very little.

43.verse: Summoning His disciples, He said to them, “I assure you: This poor widow has put in more than all those giving to the temple treasury.

44.verse: For they all gave out of their surplus, but she out of her poverty has put in everything she possessed—all she had to live on.”

1.verse: Destruction of the Temple Predicted - As He was going out of the temple complex, one of His disciples said to Him, “Teacher, look! What massive stones! What impressive buildings!”

2.verse: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left here on another that will not be thrown down!”

3.verse: Signs of the End of the Age - While He was sitting on the Mount of Olives across from the temple complex, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately,

4.verse: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign when all these things are about to take place?”

5.verse: Then Jesus began by telling them: “Watch out that no one deceives you.

6.verse: Many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and they will deceive many.

7.verse: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be alarmed; these things must take place, but the end is not yet.

8.verse: For nation will rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.

9.verse: Persecutions Predicted - “But you, be on your guard! They will hand you over to sanhedrins, and you will be flogged in the synagogues. You will stand before governors and kings because of Me, as a witness to them.

10.verse: And the good news must first be proclaimed to all nations.

11.verse: So when they arrest you and hand you over, don’t worry beforehand what you will say. On the contrary, whatever is given to you in that hour—say it. For it isn’t you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.

12.verse: Then brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rise up against parents and put them to death.

13.verse: And you will be hated by everyone because of My name. But the one who endures to the end will be delivered.

14.verse: The Great Tribulation - “When you see the abomination that causes desolation standing where it should not” (let the reader understand), “then those in Judea must flee to the mountains!

15.verse: A man on the housetop must not come down or go in to get anything out of his house.

16.verse: And a man in the field must not go back to get his clothes.

17.verse: Woe to pregnant women and nursing mothers in those days!

18.verse: Pray it won’t happen in winter.

19.verse: For those will be days of tribulation, the kind that hasn’t been from the beginning of the world, which God created, until now and never will be again!

20.verse: Unless the Lord limited those days, no one would survive. But He limited those days because of the elect, whom He chose.

21.verse: “Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah! Look—there!’ do not believe it!

22.verse: For false messiahs and false prophets will rise up and will perform signs and wonders to lead astray, if possible, the elect.

23.verse: And you must watch! I have told you everything in advance.

24.verse: The Coming of the Son of Man - “But in those days, after that tribulation: The sun will be darkened, and the moon will not shed its light;

25.verse: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the celestial powers will be shaken.

26.verse: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

27.verse: He will send out the angels and gather His elect from the four winds, from the end of the earth to the end of the sky.

28.verse: The Parable of the Fig Tree - “Learn this parable from the fig tree: As soon as its branch becomes tender and sprouts leaves, you know that summer is near.

29.verse: In the same way, when you see these things happening, know that He is near—at the door!

30.verse: I assure you: This generation will certainly not pass away until all these things take place.

31.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will never pass away.

32.verse: No One Knows the Day or Hour - “Now concerning that day or hour no one knows—neither the angels in heaven nor the Son—except the Father.

33.verse: Watch! Be alert! For you don’t know when the time is coming.

34.verse: It is like a man on a journey, who left his house, gave authority to his slaves, gave each one his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to be alert.

35.verse: Therefore be alert, since you don’t know when the master of the house is coming—whether in the evening or at midnight or at the crowing of the rooster or early in the morning.

36.verse: Otherwise, he might come suddenly and find you sleeping.

37.verse: And what I say to you, I say to everyone: Be alert!”

1.verse: The Plot to Kill Jesus - After two days it was the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the scribes were looking for a treacherous way to arrest and kill Him.

2.verse: “Not during the festival,” they said, “or there may be rioting among the people.”

3.verse: The Anointing at Bethany - While He was in Bethany at the house of Simon who had a serious skin disease, as He was reclining at the table, a woman came with an alabaster jar of pure and expensive fragrant oil of nard. She broke the jar and poured it on His head.

4.verse: But some were expressing indignation to one another: “Why has this fragrant oil been wasted?

5.verse: For this oil might have been sold for more than 300 denarii and given to the poor.” And they began to scold her.

6.verse: Then Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you bothering her? She has done a noble thing for Me.

7.verse: You always have the poor with you, and you can do what is good for them whenever you want, but you do not always have Me.

8.verse: She has done what she could; she has anointed My body in advance for burial.

9.verse: I assure you: Wherever the gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told in memory of her.”

10.verse: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to hand Him over to them.

11.verse: And when they heard this, they were glad and promised to give him silver. So he started looking for a good opportunity to betray Him.

12.verse: Preparation for Passover - On the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrifice the Passover lamb, His disciples asked Him, “Where do You want us to go and prepare the Passover so You may eat it?”

13.verse: So He sent two of His disciples and told them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a water jug will meet you. Follow him.

14.verse: Wherever he enters, tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room for Me to eat the Passover with My disciples?”’

15.verse: He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make the preparations for us there.”

16.verse: So the disciples went out, entered the city, and found it just as He had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

17.verse: Betrayal at the Passover - When evening came, He arrived with the Twelve.

18.verse: While they were reclining and eating, Jesus said, “I assure you: One of you will betray Me—one who is eating with Me!”

19.verse: They began to be distressed and to say to Him one by one, “Surely not I?”

20.verse: He said to them, “It is one of the Twelve—the one who is dipping bread with Me in the bowl.

21.verse: For the Son of Man will go just as it is written about Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had not been born.”

22.verse: The First Lord’s Supper - As they were eating, He took bread, blessed and broke it, gave it to them, and said, “Take it; this is My body.”

23.verse: Then He took a cup, and after giving thanks, He gave it to them, and so they all drank from it.

24.verse: He said to them, “This is My blood that establishes the covenant; it is shed for many.

25.verse: I assure you: I will no longer drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it in a new way in the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: After singing psalms, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

27.verse: Peter’s Denial Predicted - Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will run away, because it is written: I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.

28.verse: But after I have been resurrected, I will go ahead of you to Galilee.”

29.verse: Peter told Him, “Even if everyone runs away, I will certainly not!”

30.verse: “I assure you,” Jesus said to him, “today, this very night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times!”

31.verse: But he kept insisting, “If I have to die with You, I will never deny You!” And they all said the same thing.

32.verse: The Prayer in the Garden - Then they came to a place named Gethsemane, and He told His disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”

33.verse: He took Peter, James, and John with Him, and He began to be deeply distressed and horrified.

34.verse: Then He said to them, “My soul is swallowed up in sorrow —to the point of death. Remain here and stay awake.”

35.verse: Then He went a little farther, fell to the ground, and began to pray that if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him.

36.verse: And He said, “Abba, Father! All things are possible for You. Take this cup away from Me. Nevertheless, not what I will, but what You will.”

37.verse: Then He came and found them sleeping. “Simon, are you sleeping?” He asked Peter. “Couldn’t you stay awake one hour?

38.verse: Stay awake and pray so that you won’t enter into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

39.verse: Once again He went away and prayed, saying the same thing.

40.verse: And He came again and found them sleeping, because they could not keep their eyes open. They did not know what to say to Him.

41.verse: Then He came a third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The time has come. Look, the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.

42.verse: Get up; let’s go! See—My betrayer is near.”

43.verse: The Judas Kiss - While He was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, suddenly arrived. With him was a mob, with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

44.verse: His betrayer had given them a signal. “The One I kiss,” he said, “He’s the One; arrest Him and take Him away under guard.”

45.verse: So when he came, he went right up to Him and said, “Rabbi!”—and kissed Him.

46.verse: Then they took hold of Him and arrested Him.

47.verse: And one of those who stood by drew his sword, struck the high priest’s slave, and cut off his ear.

48.verse: But Jesus said to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs, as though I were a criminal, to capture Me?

49.verse: Every day I was among you, teaching in the temple complex, and you didn’t arrest Me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”

50.verse: Then they all deserted Him and ran away.

51.verse: Now a certain young man, having a linen cloth wrapped around his naked body, was following Him. They caught hold of him,

52.verse: but he left the linen cloth behind and ran away naked.

53.verse: Jesus Faces the Sanhedrin - They led Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes convened.

54.verse: Peter followed Him at a distance, right into the high priest’s courtyard. He was sitting with the temple police, warming himself by the fire.

55.verse: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, but they could find none.

56.verse: For many were giving false testimony against Him, but the testimonies did not agree.

57.verse: Some stood up and were giving false testimony against Him, stating,

58.verse: “We heard Him say, ‘I will demolish this sanctuary made by human hands, and in three days I will build another not made by hands.’”

59.verse: Yet their testimony did not agree even on this.

60.verse: Then the high priest stood up before them all and questioned Jesus, “Don’t You have an answer to what these men are testifying against You?”

61.verse: But He kept silent and did not answer anything. Again the high priest questioned Him, “Are You the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”

62.verse: “I am,” said Jesus, “and all of you will see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of the Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”

63.verse: Then the high priest tore his robes and said, “Why do we still need witnesses?

64.verse: You have heard the blasphemy! What is your decision?” And they all condemned Him to be deserving of death.

65.verse: Then some began to spit on Him, to blindfold Him, and to beat Him, saying, “Prophesy!” The temple police also took Him and slapped Him.

66.verse: Peter Denies His Lord - While Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the high priest’s servants came.

67.verse: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus.”

68.verse: But he denied it: “I don’t know or understand what you’re talking about!” Then he went out to the entryway, and a rooster crowed.

69.verse: When the servant saw him again she began to tell those standing nearby, “This man is one of them!”

70.verse: But again he denied it. After a little while those standing there said to Peter again, “You certainly are one of them, since you’re also a Galilean!”

71.verse: Then he started to curse and to swear with an oath, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about!”

72.verse: Immediately a rooster crowed a second time, and Peter remembered when Jesus had spoken the word to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.” When he thought about it, he began to weep.

1.verse: Jesus Faces Pilate - As soon as it was morning, the chief priests had a meeting with the elders, scribes, and the whole Sanhedrin. After tying Jesus up, they led Him away and handed Him over to Pilate.

2.verse: So Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He answered him, “You have said it.”

3.verse: And the chief priests began to accuse Him of many things.

4.verse: Then Pilate questioned Him again, “Are You not answering anything? Look how many things they are accusing You of!”

5.verse: But Jesus still did not answer anything, so Pilate was amazed.

6.verse: Jesus or Barabbas - At the festival it was Pilate’s custom to release for the people a prisoner they requested.

7.verse: There was one named Barabbas, who was in prison with rebels who had committed murder during the rebellion.

8.verse: The crowd came up and began to ask Pilate to do for them as was his custom.

9.verse: So Pilate answered them, “Do you want me to release the King of the Jews for you?”

10.verse: For he knew it was because of envy that the chief priests had handed Him over.

11.verse: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd so that he would release Barabbas to them instead.

12.verse: Pilate asked them again, “Then what do you want me to do with the One you call the King of the Jews?”

14.verse: Then Pilate said to them, “Why? What has He done wrong?” But they shouted, “Crucify Him!” all the more.

15.verse: Then, willing to gratify the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. And after having Jesus flogged, he handed Him over to be crucified.

16.verse: Mocked by the Military - Then the soldiers led Him away into the courtyard (that is, headquarters) and called the whole company together.

17.verse: They dressed Him in a purple robe, twisted together a crown of thorns, and put it on Him.

18.verse: And they began to salute Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

19.verse: They kept hitting Him on the head with a reed and spitting on Him. Getting down on their knees, they were paying Him homage.

20.verse: When they had mocked Him, they stripped Him of the purple robe, put His clothes on Him, and led Him out to crucify Him.

21.verse: Crucified between Two Criminals - They forced a man coming in from the country, who was passing by, to carry Jesus’ cross. He was Simon, a Cyrenian, the father of Alexander and Rufus.

22.verse: And they brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means Skull Place).

23.verse: They tried to give Him wine mixed with myrrh, but He did not take it.

24.verse: Then they crucified Him and divided His clothes, casting lots for them to decide what each would get.

25.verse: Now it was nine in the morning when they crucified Him.

26.verse: The inscription of the charge written against Him was: THE KING OF THE JEWS.

27.verse: They crucified two criminals with Him, one on His right and one on His left.

28.verse: [ So the Scripture was fulfilled that says: And He was counted among outlaws.]

29.verse: Those who passed by were yelling insults at Him, shaking their heads, and saying, “Ha! The One who would demolish the sanctuary and build it in three days,

30.verse: save Yourself by coming down from the cross!”

31.verse: In the same way, the chief priests with the scribes were mocking Him to one another and saying, “He saved others; He cannot save Himself!

32.verse: Let the Messiah, the King of Israel, come down now from the cross, so that we may see and believe.” Even those who were crucified with Him were taunting Him.

33.verse: The Death of Jesus - When it was noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.

34.verse: And at three Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lemá sabachtháni?” which is translated, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”

35.verse: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “Look, He’s calling for Elijah!”

36.verse: Someone ran and filled a sponge with sour wine, fixed it on a reed, offered Him a drink, and said, “Let’s see if Elijah comes to take Him down!”

37.verse: But Jesus let out a loud cry and breathed His last.

38.verse: Then the curtain of the sanctuary was split in two from top to bottom.

39.verse: When the centurion, who was standing opposite Him, saw the way He breathed His last, he said, “This man really was God’s Son!”

40.verse: There were also women looking on from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.

41.verse: When He was in Galilee, they would follow Him and help Him. Many other women had come up with Him to Jerusalem.

42.verse: The Burial of Jesus - When it was already evening, because it was preparation day (that is, the day before the Sabbath),

43.verse: Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the Sanhedrin who was himself looking forward to the kingdom of God, came and boldly went in to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body.

44.verse: Pilate was surprised that He was already dead. Summoning the centurion, he asked him whether He had already died.

45.verse: When he found out from the centurion, he gave the corpse to Joseph.

46.verse: After he bought some fine linen, he took Him down and wrapped Him in the linen. Then he placed Him in a tomb cut out of the rock, and rolled a stone against the entrance to the tomb.

47.verse: Now Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were watching where He was placed.

1.verse: Resurrection Morning - When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, so they could go and anoint Him.

2.verse: Very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they went to the tomb at sunrise.

3.verse: They were saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone from the entrance to the tomb for us?”

4.verse: Looking up, they observed that the stone—which was very large—had been rolled away.

5.verse: When they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a long white robe sitting on the right side; they were amazed and alarmed.

6.verse: “Don’t be alarmed,” he told them. “You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has been resurrected! He is not here! See the place where they put Him.

7.verse: But go, tell His disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you to Galilee; you will see Him there just as He told you.’”

8.verse: So they went out and started running from the tomb, because trembling and astonishment overwhelmed them. And they said nothing to anyone, since they were afraid.

9.verse: Appearances of the Risen Lord - [ Early on the first day of the week, after He had risen, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had driven seven demons.

10.verse: She went and reported to those who had been with Him, as they were mourning and weeping.

11.verse: Yet, when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe it.

12.verse: Then after this, He appeared in a different form to two of them walking on their way into the country.

13.verse: And they went and reported it to the rest, who did not believe them either.

14.verse: The Great Commission - Later, He appeared to the Eleven themselves as they were reclining at the table. He rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who saw Him after He had been resurrected.

15.verse: Then He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to the whole creation.

16.verse: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.

17.verse: And these signs will accompany those who believe: In My name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new languages;

18.verse: they will pick up snakes; if they should drink anything deadly, it will never harm them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will get well.”

19.verse: The Ascension - Then after speaking to them, the Lord Jesus was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.

20.verse: And they went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word by the accompanying signs.]
